def_en: The establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules, the punishment of offenders and the organisations and bodies involved in these activities
Violations of laws by individuals, companies or organisations
The system of courts of law
The equitable administration of laws and regulations
The codification of rules of behaviour
Agencies that attempt to prevent disobedience to established laws or bring to justice those who disobey those laws
Man made or natural event resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property
A sudden, unexpected event that causes unwanted consequences or requires immediate action
A sudden, unplanned event that causes great damage or loss of life, such as an accident or a natural catastrophe
A sudden, unexpected event that requires immediate action to prevent serious consequences
Planning for actions to deal with sudden, unplanned events
The planning and efforts made by people and organizations to help victims of a sudden, unplanned event, natural disaster or crisis
All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.
Information about individual business entities, including companies, corporations, charities
Products and services consumed by companies and individuals and the companies that manufacture or manage them
Production, consumption, distribution and trade activities affecting regions or countries as a whole
Organisations set up to create and sell a product or service
Market for buying and selling stocks, currencies, commodities and other goods
All aspects of furthering knowledge, formally or informally
Group of parents set up to support educational activities of their children
Instruction by any faith about that faith's principles and beliefs, including Sunday school or preparation for a religious rite, such as a bar mitzvah
A building or institution in which education is provided
The learning of social skills and behaviours through the imitation and observation of others. This can include formal and informal instruction around empathy, emotions and mental health.
Either end of the education equation
The courses offered by a learning institution and the regulation of those courses
Polices and standards around the testing and assessment of students, including the merits of standardised testing, and testing methods
Exams for entering colleges, universities and all other higher and lower education institutions
Students as a demographic, including student protests and requests for change and trends among students
Teachers as a demographic, including teacher unions, teacher education and training and the criteria for teachers in various locations
Education that provides students with practical experience and training in a particular occupational field. It is sometimes referred to as career education or technical education
The evaluation of a student's achievement on a test, assignment or course and the policies and methods around assigning those grades

Learning where a student and teacher are not physically present in the same location. Instruction can occur synchronously or asynchronously and utilizes technology such as video conferencing, online assessments and video conferencing.
The protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet Earth and its surroundings
All issues relating to extreme changes in climate, including rising global temperature, debate on the causes and solutions of global warming, greenhouse gases and ways to reduce emissions
Preservation of the natural world, such as wilderness areas, flora and fauna
The contamination of natural resources by harmful substances
Assets afforded by nature without human intervention that can be used for various purposes, such as providing energy or industrial materials
The natural world
Actions by organizations, governments, and individuals in response to environmental problems
All aspects of physical and mental well-being
Any health conditions affecting humans
Facilities used for any kind of health care
Specific health organisations, including professional associations, non-profit and international groups
Remedies, therapies, interventions, medications, testing and treatments to prevent, diagnose, manage or improve a health condition
Health care provided by governments at any level
Insurance covering medical costs
Health care provided by private organisations
Profession requiring formal training in the study, diagnosis, treatment, care and prevention of disease, medical condition or injury
Any harmful or destructive health condition affecting animals, plants or microorganisms.
Organised public or private measures designed to prevent disease, promote health and prolong life among the population as a whole
Item that discusses individuals, groups, animals, plants or other objects in an emotional way
Achievements by individuals or groups, animals, plants or other objects, such as winning a competitive contest etc

The recognition of an achievement in a field in the form of a symbolic item, such as a plaque or trophy or in the form of a monetary gift, such as a cash prize or grant, given by a government or private institution
Non-sport achievement by an individual or group that sets a new record, such as most books read or holding one's breath the longest
Rituals, such as dedications, wreath laying or celebrating the launching of a ship
Individuals or groups with a focus on emotional facets
Silly or stupid human errors
Life and behaviour of the rich and socialites
Life and behaviour of famous people
The celebration or commemoration of a significant amount of years since an event or a notable person's birth or death
A celebration on the anniversary of a person's birth.
Social aspects, organisations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.
The state of having work, usually paid, for a company, organisation, or individual
Laws governing employment
The supply and demand of labour in an economy
The relationship between workers and employers
The years after work
The state of being available to work but not having a job
Groups established to represent bodies of workers in order to obtain better workplace conditions through collective bargaining
Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.
Activities carried out in ones' spare time and not in a competitive way.
The way in which a person lives, including their style and possessions
The active pursuit of good mental and physical health
Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, the day-to-day running of government, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.
The selection of government representatives by the casting of votes by the populace
The systems, institutions and people who run a political entity
An overall plan or course of action set out by a government intended to influence and guide decisions
Relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or diplomacy
Groups officially outside of government that lobby, demonstrate or campaign on a wide range of issues such as economics, the environment and healthcare
Conflict that rises to a level where, depending on events, governments can fall etc
Individuals who put themselves at risk by expressing their political views and the imprisonment of individuals who speak out against a political authority
The art or science of participating in the affairs of government, a state of political party
Belief systems, institutions and people who provide moral guidance to followers
A set of beliefs prescribed by an institution or text often focusing on the worship of a higher power and the outlining of moral guidelines
Any form of communication between religions
Conflicts involving religious differences
News regarding a religious event but not a festival or holiday
Holy day or period of observance in a religion which is sometimes a public holiday
Established religious rituals such as mass, baptism, prayer meetings and bar and bat mitzvah
Any facility where a group carries out its religious rites

label_fr: Relations entre les institutions religieuses et l'Etat
def_en: Matters arising from the relationship between religions and a government, including the question of whether churches should pay taxes, the push to keep religion out of publicly funded institutions and the freedom, or lack of to wear religious symbols in a school setting
Person or persons who have a ritual, juridical or otherwise leading role in their respective church or religion
Texts regarded as holy or important by a religion
The concerns, issues, affairs and institutions relevant to human social interactions, problems and welfare, such as poverty, human rights and family planning
The political, social, cultural and economic rights to which all people are entitled, usually upheld by law
A group of individuals actively sharing a common value or interest
The study of human populations and their characteristics, for example statistics or trends around aging populations in a particular geographic region
The movement of individuals or groups of people from one country to another
Leaving one's country of residence to settle permanently elsewhere

Unfair treatment of, or policies or practices against, individuals or groups of people on the basis of real or perceived membership in a group, such as race, sexual orientation, political or religious beliefs, age or height
A group of people related genetically or by a legal bond, or who consider themselves part of a familial unit regardless of genetic or legal status
A subset of society with shared traits
The circumstances or state of affairs affecting a person's life, welfare and relations with others in a society
Issues related to human rights, human welfare and other areas of societal concern
A person's or group's principles or standards of behaviour, which guide their way of living and choices made
Help for those in need of food, housing, health and other services

Efforts that seeks to promote the fair treatment and full participation of groups of people who have historically been underrepresented or subject to discrimination on the basis of identity or disability
Competitive activity or skill that involves physical and/or mental effort and organisations and bodies involved in these activities
Different types of sport which can be executed in competitions
Actions, including fines and suspensions levied by sports organisations and teams
Drug use associated with sport activities, including doping, abuse, testing and permitted medical uses
An event featuring one or more sport competitions
Commercial issues related to sport
Organisations or associations that govern sports
Gymnasiums, stadiums, arenas or facilities where sports events take place
The transfer of an athlete from one team to another, the hiring or drafting of an athlete onto a team or the change in professional status of a player on a team
Records or honours earned by athletes for their performance
The staff responsible for the training and on-field management of a sports team
The executive leadership and owners of a sports team
Referees, umpires and other staff who enforce the rules of a sport from on the field of play
Cyber attacks, or suspected attacks, involving a government entity as either the sponsor or the target, or preventive measures against these types of actions
Individuals who are injured or killed in a war or armed conflict, including civilians
